title: Individual Rating factor into LP
body:
Since Riot have added a system to individually rate players based on their performance in a game, maybe it's time that system factored into Ranked:

High player rating decreases LP lost in loss (team dragged you down).
Low rating decreases LP gained in Win (you were carried).
Also make ratings affect your placement.

It's still SO FLAWED that you get individual points PURELY from a team's result in an individual queue style of game.

replies.body:
Hi Kieshwa, The new method you are describing is the exact opposite of what happens now
The ranked system has 2 different values to show your rank. One, the one players are able to see, is your LP. This changes at the end of every game and it relies on your second value, the MMR, or Match making rank, to show calculate the change in LP at the end of a game. No one outside of Riot can see your MMR. Each rank is associated with a certain MMR, so if you are in a rank above what your MMR says you should be, you will gain MMR faster. Each team has a team MMR, so if your MMR corresponds to bronze 3 and you beat a bronze 2 enemy, you will gain more LP for a win and lose less LP for a loss, as you are fighting above your rank and are expected to lose, and the system . If your opponent is at bronze 4 level of MMR as a team, you will lose more LP for a loss and gain less LP for a win, as the ranked system sees your MMR as more skilled than the opposing team, and punishes you for losing to a weaker team,
In short, the exact opposite of what you described.

There is more information about the MMR system at these links

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204010760-Ranked-Play-FAQ
An official Riot Games FAQ about the ranked system, LP, and MMR.

http://gaming.stackexchange.com/questions/209734/how-is-lp-calculated
http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=3409638
Community members explaining MMR and the match making system used by League of Legends to other community members

Edit:I just realized you were talking about the S, A, B, C, D system of ranking individual performance. 
While many people agree with your idea about this having an impact, it makes the game a killstealing competition for the losing team, with every player attempting not to lose too much LP. This reduces the chance of a well coordinated team mounting a comeback, punishes the supports, and leads to an overall loss of enjoyment for the losing team, so this system can never work.
